title: Isolate the Radical
text: Isolate the radical on one side of the equation. We can add $$5$$ on both sides get $$\sqrt{2m-3}=5$$ which has radicals isolated on one side.

title: Raise Both Sides Of the Equation To The Power Of The Index
speech: the square root of 2 m minus 3 end root, squared is equal to, 5 squared \nAfter squaring both sides, we get  2 m minus 3 is equal to 25 .
